channel.title: [req] router hack
channel.description:
Sorry i havent been very active... probably nobody noticed but i've been hard working at school.
My question/request is there some way i can stop my router from being capped?
I only just realised i could get higher speeds because my laptop can download at 120kbps and no higher, but at the same time my pc at the same router can dl at 120kbps too.
I thought it was just the speed of my internet that was capping it, but it must be the router.
My friend has exactly the same internet package and he gets 500kbps+ when download torrents... my downloads NEVER go above 120kbps
So is there some way i can do something to my router to take the cap off?
TY TY
edit - my router is a "netgear DG834g v3"

speed test is

item.title: [req] router hack
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:22, topic:146096”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=200058.msg1779685#msg1779685 date=1190730370]
Move country, British interwebs is bad, we have one of the worst speeds in the world.
Pretty sad really considering we are one of the most developed country’s in the world yet we are so far behind on such an important thing such as internet.

[/quote]

Ever heard of Virgin? It uses cable unlike Tiscali and BT. I can get amazing speeds on that bitch but the problem is they have to dig up your road if you don’t already have a cable connection near your house. I get 2000kb/s sometimes and I’m in Britain, also on that speedtest thing its 10000kb/s. IMO that’s pretty fast although I wouldn’t mind having a connection like China (without all the censorship)[/quote]
yes i would have that exept i live in one of the poorest area for most technologies.

Also people im really sorry i got the router name wrong, its actually a

“DG834G v3”

Thanks.

it’s a router and modem in one.

But what’s your default gateway? You have to telnet that (You can find your gateway at dos typing ipconfig)

item.title: [req] router hack
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

therealjdb:

Well a router takes the incoming signal and splits it so you can network your whole house off of one incoming line. A modem converts the signal coming in from the line into something usable to the computer

Yeah i think its a router kuz it actually goes like dis

Phone jack > Router/modem > computer;laptop

The laptop is connecter through the wireless and the computer is connected directly.

So is router or modem? or a hybrid like roudem or moder
??

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`

item.title: [req] router hack
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Moparisthebest:

If you think your router is limiting you, the solution is simple. Bypass the router by hooking the modem directly into your computer and see if the download speeds improve, then you will know if the router is actually limiting you or not. I doubt the router is limiting you though.

uhh i dont understand… my computer is hooked up like so

Wall plug phone jack thing > router > computer

S!ms:

As you’re a noob at this stuff, I think you run XP Press Start > Run > telnet 192.168.2.1 Then search for something that let’s you change the value. (or you might type help to see a list of commands).

Correct i am a noob, correct again i run XP, incorrect when i do “start > run > telnet 192.168.2.1” it just says connecting…

Read full topic

item.title: [req] router hack
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

If you think your router is limiting you, the solution is simple. Bypass the router by hooking the modem directly into your computer and see if the download speeds improve, then you will know if the router is actually limiting you or not. I doubt the router is limiting you though.

Read full topic
